fields.summary: Fix some cmake plugin and native build warnings

comments.body: Remove some unused imports, clean up some whitespace, etc. etc.
One other thing I noticed, there's a TODO in CompileMojo about setting the # of processors which can be deleted, since we consult Runtime now.

This message was automatically generated.

Overall LGTM, though please take a look at the Jenkins -1s, seem native build related.

I'm also kind of shocked by the {{extract_values}} change. I guess we have a lucky implicit return since {{extract_values_delim}} will set EAX and hopefully it bubbles up, but that seems compiler/optimization-level dependent. I think this is undefined behavior.

Ping [~vvasudev] and [~ashahab] as the original authors, as a heads up on this bug.
I'll also +1 since these Jenkins failures do not seem related to this precise patch, but possibly the HADOOP-8887 change. Let's track that down in a different JIRA.

Thanks, [~andrew.wang].  I've filed YETUS-286 for the mysterious "failed to map segment from shared object" failures.  They seem to come and go.  I agree we should get this patch in since it is not the cause of those failures.

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9124 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9124/])
HADOOP-12712. Fix some cmake plugin and native build warnings (cmccabe) (cmccabe: rev b2c155f810888480d058512a326a5083e1bb4eaa)
* hadoop-maven-plugins/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/maven/plugin/util/Exec.java
* hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/main/native/container-executor/impl/configuration.c
* hadoop-maven-plugins/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/maven/plugin/cmakebuilder/CompileMojo.java
* hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/native/src/org/apache/hadoop/net/unix/DomainSocket.c
* hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt
* hadoop-maven-plugins/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/maven/plugin/cmakebuilder/TestMojo.java

Thanks for catching this [~cmccabe]. My apologies for letting this slip through. Like Andrew, I suspect some implicit return was carried out by the compiler. I've cherry-picked the patch to 2.8 as well.
Thanks, [~vvasudev].  Yes, it was very odd that it even worked without the return statement.  But it did seem to (on my computer, at least).  It's good to have this fixed.
